html:
Asian stock markets have plunged and oil prices surged to nearly $100 per barrel after President Vladimir Putin announced Russian military action in Ukraine

New York City police say a former Amazon employee leading a push to unionize one of the online retailer's warehouses has been arrested

The threat of war has shredded Ukraine's economy, and many Ukrainians are asking why they are the ones suffering instead of Russia

The World Health Organization is creating a global training center to help poorer countries make vaccines, antibodies and cancer treatments using the messenger RNA technology used to make COVID-19 vaccines

The European Union has agreed to slap sanctions on Russia's defense minister and a top presidential adviser

Britain promised to hit Russia with "powerful" sanctions over its military confrontation with Ukraine

Automaker Stellantis says it made a solid 13.4 billion euros in its first year

The CEO of Ford Motor Co. says the automaker has no plans to spin off its electric vehicle or internal combustion businesses

The Italian city regarded as the birthplace of the Renaissance is concerned with more mundane matters these days

A federal judge has extended an order preventing the two largest unions at BNSF from going on strike over a new attendance policy the railroad imposed this month
